alert.note: Alert for Blaine (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 3:41AM MDT until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River near Harlem affecting Blaine County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the Fresno Reservoir Dam. For the Milk River...including Harlem...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River near Harlem. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Flooding of culverts and some county bridges. 2,000 acres of irrigated land becomes flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM MDT Monday the stage was 19.75 feet. - The river at this forecast point has fallen below flood stage, and it should continue falling during the day Monday. This will likely hinder additional flooding until it is forecast to start rising again Monday night, but impacts from earlier flooding will likely linger, such as standing water in fields. - Forecast...The river is forecast to rise above flood stage Wednesday morning and crest at 22.1 feet Friday evening, before beginning to slowly fall below flood stage by the end of next weekend. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.4 feet on 05/22/1974. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Milk River Harlem 21.0 19.75 Mon 230 am MDT 20.3 21.0 21.3 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 345 PM MDT.
